We do not accept applications sent directly via email. I am looking forward to hearing from you.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
A Galp faz parte da sociedade há gerações, e à medida que a energia muda, nós também nos adaptamos. Aqui terás a oportunidade de crescer, com os recursos necessários para te desenvolveres ao teu ritmo, à tua maneira. Juntos podemos continuar a contribuir para as comunidades onde vivemos e trabalhamos. Podemos construir um futuro mais eficiente para nós próprios e para as gerações futuras. Contamos com a tua energia ⚡







Junta-te à Galp e traz a tua curiosidade e paixão no dia a dia

Irá integrar a unidade de negócio de Energy Management que inclui o aprovisionamento, trading e expedição de petróleo, biocombustíveis, gás natural, eletricidade e produtos ambientais - tanto de capital próprio como de terceiros.

Estas operações proporcionam maior valor ao longo da cadeia integrada de negócio da Galp, na medida em que procuram aproveitar proactivamente as oportunidades comerciais, maximizar a margem integrada e navegar na dinâmica e volatilidade do mercado energético.







Sabe mais sobre a tua futura equipa

Irá integrar a equipa de Sistemas Digitais e Dados, que faz parte da Unidade de Energy management. Trata-se de um departamento de negociação de várias mercadorias e de equipas de apoio com pessoas motivadas, apaixonadas e dedicadas

Trabalhará para uma equipa multidisciplinar que se dedica a potenciar o negócio e a vida quotidiana das pessoas através da tecnologia
A sua principal missão é otimizar e melhorar os algoritmos que ajudam as pessoas a alcançar um negócio sustentável, eficiente e rentável, tirando partido dos dados históricos do mercado da energia, dos padrões meteorológicos, dos indicadores económicos e das perspectivas comerciais







Descobre mais sobre o teu dia a dia

Desenvolver e manter soluções de tomada de decisões baseadas em dados.
Procurar continuamente melhorias juntamente com outros cientistas de dados e utilizadores finais.
Compilar, classificar, organizar, interpretar e analisar dados de várias fontes internas e externas utilizando as técnicas mais avançadas.
Aplicar ferramentas e técnicas de business intelligence e de análise de dados para fornecer informações e recomendações práticas.
Desenvolver, testar e validar hipóteses através da aplicação de uma série de técnicas matemáticas, estatísticas, científicas e/ou computacionais.
Fazer apresentações técnicas e comerciais.
Colaborar e participar ativamente na representação do departamento e da empresa em projectos digitais e de dados com equipas externas e parcerias académicas.
Monitorizar e melhorar os algoritmos ao longo do seu ciclo de vida.
Manter-se atualizado sobre os últimos desenvolvimentos em matéria de ciência de dados e tendências energéticas.
Expandir continuamente o seu conjunto de competências para se adaptar a um panorama dinâmico.







O que te torna única

Mínimo de 3 anos de experiência como cientista de dados.
Empatia demonstrada e uma abordagem orientada para as pessoas, promovendo relações de trabalho positivas no seio da equipa e entre departamentos.
Interesse genuíno pela atividade comercial e pelas actividades de apoio essenciais, demonstrando uma mentalidade proactiva e entusiasmo em contribuir para o sucesso da organização e dos seus colaboradores.
Formação em ciências de dados
Experiência em seguir o CRISP-DM
Conhecimentos de Python
Conhecimentos e raciocínio estatísticos
Compreensão dos diferentes tipos de algoritmos, casos de utilização e limitações
Conhecimentos de bibliotecas de ciência de dados (pandas, scikit - learn, numpy, statsmodel)
Capacidade de resolução de problemas e de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipa
Experiência em análise de séries cronológicas







Na Galp, temos a ambição de ser a empresa mais centrada nas pessoas e, por isso, reconhecemos a nossa responsabilidade em promover a Diversidade, Equidade e Inclusão (DEI) no nosso dia a dia, em todos os nossos processos. Acreditamos que todas pessoas devem ser celebradas e valorizadas pelo que são - não só pelo seu potencial, mas também pelas suas características distintivas.

Na Galp, temos a ambição de ser a empresa mais centrada nas pessoas e, por isso, reconhecemos a nossa responsabilidade em promover a Diversidade, Equidade e Inclusão (DEI) no nosso dia a dia, em todos os nossos processos. Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are you going to do?

  • Leverage data and business principles to solve large-scale, mobile, and data problems;
  • Work cross-functionally to define problem statements, collect data, build analytical models, and make recommendations;
  • Build and maintain data-driven optimization models, experiments, forecasting algorithms, and capacity constraint models;
  • Communicate final recommendations and support decision-making.


What are we looking for?

  • Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science);
  • 2+ years experience as a Data Scientist or in a role closely related to data (e.g. Analytics);
  • 2+ years of scripting with one of these languages (PHP, R, PYTHON);
  • Experience with packages such as NumPy, SciPy, pandas, scikit-learn, dplyr, ggplot2.
  • 1+ years of SQL experience;
  • Professional experience with Java, Scala, or Spark;
  • Professional experience with GenAI (e.g., RAG, Guardrails, Langchain);
  • Knowledge of Data Governance;
  • Experience in distribution-based architectures such as Cloudera, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, etc.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • You will grow in good company. Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you!


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us: Our MIS and Data Team plays a crucial role in harnessing the power of data to drive informed decision-making and optimize business processes. We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our dynamic team and contribute to the bank's data-driven initiatives.




Key Responsibilities:

1. Data Analysis and Modeling:

Utilize advanced statistical and machine learning techniques to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain predictive models to enhance - customer segmentation and behavior
Conduct thorough evaluations of model performance and implement optimization strategies as needed.
Stay abreast of emerging methodologies and technologies to continuously improve predictive modeling techniques.

2. Collaboration with Cross-functional Teams:

Partner with data management and business intelligence teams to ensure alignment of data science initiatives with overall business goals.
Provide support and insights to other departments leveraging data-driven decision-making.




Qualifications:

Bachelor degree or Master's in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related disciplines.
Proven experience in data science and analytics, preferably in the banking or financial industry.
Strong of, statistical modeling, and data visualization techniques (preferably understanding machine learning algorithms).
Proficiency in programming languages such as SQL, Python or R, and familiarity with data manipulation and analysis libraries.
Excellent communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.







If you are a passionate and innovative data scientist looking to make a significant impact in the banking industry, we invite you to apply and be part of our forward-thinking MIS and Data Team.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Si te consideras una persona analítica, autónoma y proactiva, con gran capacidad de comunicación y con un inglés fluido, tenemos una oportunidad para ti en nuestras oficinas de Barcelona.




Como Data Scientist, contribuirás en la gestión de proyectos de Machine Learning en entorno Cloud, en contacto con stakeholders para desarrollar modelados estadísticos y predictivos.




Tus funciones principales serán…




Implementar productos Machine Learning en entorno Cloud (Snowflake, Azure, Amazon Sagemaker,..) sobre grandes volúmenes de datos y posterior seguimiento para garantizar la mejora continua de su rendimiento.
Desarrollar y producir técnicas avanzadas de modelado estadístico y predictivo, trabajando en estrecha colaboración con los stakeholders.
Tomar requerimientos con negocio, ejecutar e implantar proyectos analíticos.
Dar seguimiento a todo el ciclo de vida de los proyectos: implicar y coordinar a los equipos internos y externos, estimar los recursos y tiempos para el desarrollo de las tareas, comunicar las soluciones analíticas a los stakeholders e implementar mejoras.
Desarrollar nuevos e innovadores enfoques para resolver problemas analíticos.




¿Qué buscamos?




Ingeniería Superior en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática y Telecomunicaciones.
Experiencia de al menos 2 años como Data Scientist.
Experiencia en el desarrollo de Modelos Predictivos y de Machine Learning.
Experiencia en el uso de herramientas ML (Phyton, SQL, R,…)
Nivel fluido de inglés.
Habilidades de comunicación, trabajo en equipo, mente abierta.
Capacidad de análisis.
Capacidad de autonomía y proactividad.
Además, se valorará positivamente:
Experiencia con herramientas data discovery y data preparation.
Experiencia en el deployment de proyectos de IA/ Machine Learning.
Experiencia de forma activa en procesos de transformación de una compañía hacia una Data Driven Company.




¿Qué te ofrecemos?




4-day work-week: trabajamos 34 horas dentro de una semana laboral de 4 días para potenciar la creatividad y la conciliación. Además, contamos con flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Oficinas abiertas al mar: estamos en la Barceloneta frente al Mar Mediterráneo. Las vistas nos inspiran y el entorno nos permite disfrutar de una vida saludable: hacer deporte, llegar en bicicleta o caminando o comer al aire libre.
Podrás flexibilizar tu salario destinándolo a servicios como seguro de salud, transporte, guardería y comida. Además podrás disfrutar de café, infusiones y fruta fresca cada día.
Desigualiza tu armario: tendrás un 50% de descuento en nuestras colecciones.




¡En DESIGUAL estamos deseando conocerte!

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an innovative and passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-paced, dynamic team. As a key member of our technology division, you will play a vital role in developing, deploying, and optimizing end-to-end machine learning models. This role demands expertise in MLOps (Machine Learning Operations) and the ability to handle the entire machine learning lifecycle—from data ingestion to model deployment and beyond.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Oppizi, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers and product managers, to deliver high-quality ML solutions that directly impact business outcomes. You will also be responsible for ensuring that our models are scalable, efficient, and aligned with the company's goals.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development and Deployment: Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models that address business needs, ensuring high availability and performance in production environments
MLOps and Automation: Apply MLOps best practices to automate the ML lifecycle, including data ingestion, training, and deployment pipelines. Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery
Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor deployed models to ensure they meet performance metrics, and continuously improve them for accuracy and scalability
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to develop and communicate ML solutions effectively



Requirements

What are you bringing to the team:


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Experience: Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role
MLOps Expertise: Proven experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended)
Programming Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn
Cloud & Containerization: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
Data & API Proficiency: Experience with data manipulation and building APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django
Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Nice to have:


Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools



Benefits

Competitive salary (open to negotiation) with performance-based bonuses.

Professional growth opportunities in a fast-growing startup.

Flexible working hours and remote work options.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Data & AI, Machine Learning Team)
Description:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.







More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!




As a Machine Learning Engineer within the Data&AI department, you will be at the forefront of developing and refining machine learning models that drive key aspects of our business. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including Product and Engineering teams, to deliver impactful solutions across various domains, from personalized product recommendations and ad relevance to pricing optimization, sales forecasting, or inventory management. Your role will involve both research and hands-on model development, ensuring our algorithms remain innovative and scalable in a fast-paced environment










What you’ll have to do:




Develop cutting-edge models for search, recommendations, and advertising that elevate user experiences and drive results.·
Dive deep into massive datasets, uncovering hidden patterns and insights through exploratory analysis and advanced analytical techniques.
Design and build machine learning models using state-of-the-art techniques, adapting them for real-world production environments and optimizing for business needs and engineering constraints.
Write high-quality production code for training and inference, ensuring seamless data validation, efficient logging, reliable exception handling, and smooth orchestration for optimal performance.










How we’d like you to be:




Have a degree in a related discipline (Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Computer Science).
Have hands-on experience with TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Are proficient in SQL and have a solid understanding of relational databases.
Have a passion for diving into large datasets, asking the right questions, and uncovering insights.
Have strong problem-solving skills, especially when it comes to complex technical challenges.
Can clearly communicate technical concepts and translate them into business-focused insights for both technical and management audiences.
Have expertise in areas like Anomaly Detection, Time Series Analysis, Unsupervised Learning, Probabilistic Graphical Models, Recommender Systems, and Semantic Search.
Have a strong collaborative mindset, working seamlessly with interdisciplinary teams to tackle tough problems.
Have a solid grasp of big data architecture and application design.













What we’ve prepared for you:




Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.







Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: HR Data Scientist
Description:
We offer:




- An endless amount of interesting, complex business challenges

- A chance to influence a talent agenda that impacts over 80K employees

- A collegial atmosphere to deliver innovative solutions supported by a world-class team

- A supportive and vibrant multinational environment, we accept individual differences and believe in collaborative team working

- Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

- Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




- Construct and refine machine learning and statistical models to answer research questions relevant to informing business strategy related to workforce and talent analytics

- Collaborate on the creation and refinement of GenAI-based solutions to enhance internal HR processes.

- Ensure the operational and functional excellence of existing solutions to deliver a seamless client experience.

- Influence dashboard development and research roadmaps to improve client self-service and automation

- Work closely with HR colleagues and business stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver impactful analytics solutions.




You have:




- You hold a BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field.

- Professional experience in data science, statistics, or social science research

- You are skilled in Python (essential), SQL, and preferably in business intelligence tools. You understand various data sources and technologies such as relational databases, data lakes, and APIs.

- You are familiar with DevOps principles including version control, Git, CI/CD and basic Linux commands.

- You possess strong interpersonal skills and can effectively communicate complex data-driven insights to diverse audiences.

- Experience with natural language processing, large language models, and/or generative AI is a plus.

- You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.




Team profile:




Join our Budapest Analytics Center of Excellence, a key component of Morgan Stanley's global HR Analytics team. Our team is charged with delivering innovative solutions and insights in people analytics. HR Analytics was recognized as one of Morgan Stanley's Top 3 Strategic People Initiatives in 2020, we offer a fast-paced, high-impact environment ideal for those ready to dive in and make a significant contribution.

We are excited to learn more about you! Apply now to join our team and start making a difference with your analytical skills and insights.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are helping to shape the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management and Data & Analytics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to build a better future?




About Enfinity Global

Enfinity Global is a purpose-driven company focused on making a positive impact on the planet by helping companies, governments, and individuals transition to a carbon-free and sustainable economy. Our role as a leading IPP is to develop, finance, build, operate, and own renewable energy assets in the long term in Europe, Asia, and the Americas through our offices in the USA, Spain, Italy, UK, Netherlands, India, and Japan.




Our team of over 250 Enfiniters comprises seasoned finance professionals, as well as experienced project developers and operators with extensive industry experience across all stages of the project life cycle. We pride ourselves on being creative and innovative solution providers to our customers and partners.




We’re looking for a Data Scientis to join our Team in Milan.




Main task and duties:




Responsibilities:

· Analyze large datasets from energy production, prices, and consumption to uncover insights and trends

· Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to optimize energy usage and forecasting (e.g., renewable energy production, demand forecasting)

· Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate key findings to top management

· Assist in building and refining energy price models, optimization strategies, and risk assessment tools

· Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis

· Work closely with market intelligence team to provide actionable insights

· Stay current with trends and innovations in data science and energy markets







Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field

· Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data modeling techniques

· Proficiency in Python

· Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI

· Familiarity with SQL for data querying and database management

· Knowledge of energy markets, renewable energy, or sustainability is a plus (but not required)

· Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment

· Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights




In Enfinity Global group you will find a very dynamic and multinational environment in one of the most exciting and impactful industries. Here we will foster your professional and personal growth, and you will have the opportunity to actively contribute and make a real impact on climate change.




Let’s build our future together.







Visit www.enfinity.global to discover more about our culture and values.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
We’re currently recruiting a Data Scientist for one of our partners, a fast-growing fintech in Amsterdam. In this role, you will develop advanced models to assess credit risk and contribute to maintaining a healthy portfolio. By designing and implementing these models, you’ll play a key role in predicting default probabilities, evaluating customer creditworthiness, and enhancing overall risk management strategies.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement advanced risk models to evaluate credit risk and predict default probabilities;
  • Analyze large datasets and identify patterns to continuously improve risk assessment;
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate models into decision-making processes;
  • Ensure alignment of models with regulatory requirements and corporate strategies.


Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist;
  • Experience in the Risk domain;
  • Strong proficiency in Python and associated data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, scikit-learn, XGBoost);
  • Expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling techniques;
  • Familiarity with risk assessments.


What They Offer:

  • Secondary benefits (e.g. a well-structured pension plan, budget for personal development);
  • Salary scale up to €7,900 per month (€102.000,- annual gross incl.);
  • A informal environment within a fast growing organization.


Interested in this role?

The more you tell us about yourself, the better! Upload your CV and we will contact you as soon as possible!

Title: [CDI] Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Publicis Re:Sources is the backbone of Publicis Groupe, the world’s most valuable agency group. We are the only full-service, end-to-end shared service organization in the industry, enabling Groupe agencies to do what they do best: innovate and transform for their clients.




Formed in 1998 as a small team to service a few Publicis Groupe firms, Publicis Re:Sources has grown to 5,000+ employees in over 66 countries. We provide technology solutions and business services including finance, accounting, legal, benefits, procurement, tax, real estate, treasury and risk management.

We continually transform to keep pace with our ever-changing communications industry and thrive on a spirit of innovation felt around the globe. Learn more about Publicis Re:Sources and the Publicis Groupe agencies we support at http://www.publicisresources.com/.




Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Scientist with strong expertise in deep learning, NLP models and Computer Vision models. This role includes the opportunity to work on a groundbreaking initiative: Antigreenwashing AI, a tool designed to assess marketing campaigns for greenwashing risks against global standards.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the Antigreenwashing AI team to develop and optimize models that evaluate campaigns (text, images, and PDFs) against ARPP deontology principles and other global greenwashing guidelines. Contribute to expand towards suggestions of positive representations in communication on environmental and social aspects.v
Design and implement scalable machine learning solutions to enable real-time campaign evaluations in English, French, and other languages.
Develop, optimize, and deploy deep learning models using TensorFlow and/or PyTorch.
Work with cross-functional teams to integrate Antigreenwashing AI into the fast-paced creative processes of Publicis Groupe agencies.
Utilize Azure cloud services for scalable application architectures.
Monitor and manage machine learning experiments and model lifecycles using MLFlow.
Be aware of the environmental footprint of the software you develop and contribute to its ecodesign.




Required Skills & Experience:

0-2 years of experience in data science or machine learning roles.
Strong understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning models for classification, prediction and time series forecasting.
Strong expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Proficiency in SQL for managing and querying large datasets.
Strong understanding of multiprocessing and multithreading in Python.
Experience with cloud computing platforms, specifically Microsoft Azure.
Hands-on experience in deploying machine learning models in production environments.
Expertise in MLFlow for tracking experiments and managing machine learning pipelines.
Proficiency in English and French
Interest for textual data and ability to evaluate its relevance and clarity




Nice to Have:

Familiarity with AI models for compliance or marketing applications.
Experience with Azure Machine Learning (AML).
Familiarity with Kubernetes or Docker for model deployment.




What We Offer:

Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning problems.
A collaborative work environment with opportunities for career growth.

If you are a passionate data scientist looking to grow your skills and make an impact with innovative AI solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

Required Skills & Experience:

  • 0-2 years of experience in data science or machine learning roles.
  • Strong understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning models for classification, prediction and time series forecasting.
  • Strong expertise in deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
  • Proficiency in SQL for managing and querying large datasets.
  • Strong understanding of multiprocessing and multithreading in Python.
  • Experience with cloud computing platforms, specifically Microsoft Azure.
  • Hands-on experience in deploying machine learning models in production environments.
  • Expertise in MLFlow for tracking experiments and managing machine learning pipelines.
  • Proficiency in English and French
  • Interest for textual data and ability to evaluate its relevance and clarity


Nice to Have:

  • Familiarity with AI models for compliance or marketing applications.
  • Experience with Azure Machine Learning (AML).
  • Familiarity with Kubernetes or Docker for model deployment.


What We Offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Opportunity to work on cutting-edge machine learning problems.
  • A collaborative work environment with opportunities for career growth.

If you are a passionate data scientist looking to grow your skills and make an impact with innovative AI solutions, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
With just over 7 years of experience in the Portuguese market, we share our DNA with more than 200 workers and position our offer according to 3 lines of service:

  • Strategy (Outsourcing, NeXel, Team as a Service, Tech Academies);
  • R&D (Bootcamps, POC, Tech Lab);
  • Nearshore.


In ADENTIS, we focus on PEOPLE. This is our emotional salary:

  • Great Work-Life balance;
  • Very flexible organizational routine;
  • Health benefits (for you and your family);
  • Team Building activities;
  • Over 300 protocols to offer you great discounts in different areas;
  • Continuous professional development sponsored by our Training and Certification Department;
  • Regular feedback on your performance through a personalized plan;
  • Comprehensive career plan and progression involving assertive performance reviews.


Responsibilities:

•Collaborate and interact regularly with diverse stakeholders and other data teams across Siemens as a consultant and enabler.

•Implement and develop solutions for business uses cases applying AI/ML techniques and frameworks, including LLM models

•Ensure security and privacy compliance with data standards for data handling and model deployment.

You must have:

•Knowledge and understanding of ML models, including LLM

•Experience working with Databases (relation and non-relational), Data Structures (json, xml) and using SQL

•Programming experience in Python and any Data Science & ML packages, such as: numpy, pandas, matplotlib, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Keras, nltk, spacy, gensim;

•Experience communicating and dealing with different stakeholders

•Familiarity with agile methodologies, such as SCRUM

•European Union Citizenship or Portuguese Working Visa / Portuguese Residency.

•Availability to go to the office, twice a week.

If you want to be part of a real People First organization, join us! Send your CV to andre.lago@adentis.pt

Title: HR Data Scientist
Description:
We offer:




- An endless amount of interesting, complex business challenges

- A chance to influence a talent agenda that impacts over 80K employees

- A collegial atmosphere to deliver innovative solutions supported by a world-class team

- A supportive and vibrant multinational environment, we accept individual differences and believe in collaborative team working

- Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

- Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




- Construct and refine machine learning and statistical models to answer research questions relevant to informing business strategy related to workforce and talent analytics

- Collaborate on the creation and refinement of GenAI-based solutions to enhance internal HR processes.

- Ensure the operational and functional excellence of existing solutions to deliver a seamless client experience.

- Influence dashboard development and research roadmaps to improve client self-service and automation

- Work closely with HR colleagues and business stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver impactful analytics solutions.




You have:




- You hold a BSc or MSc in Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Economics, or a related quantitative field.

- Professional experience in data science, statistics, or social science research

- You are skilled in Python (essential), SQL, and preferably in business intelligence tools. You understand various data sources and technologies such as relational databases, data lakes, and APIs.

- You are familiar with DevOps principles including version control, Git, CI/CD and basic Linux commands.

- You possess strong interpersonal skills and can effectively communicate complex data-driven insights to diverse audiences.

- Experience with natural language processing, large language models, and/or generative AI is a plus.

- You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.




Team profile:




Join our Budapest Analytics Center of Excellence, a key component of Morgan Stanley's global HR Analytics team. Our team is charged with delivering innovative solutions and insights in people analytics. HR Analytics was recognized as one of Morgan Stanley's Top 3 Strategic People Initiatives in 2020, we offer a fast-paced, high-impact environment ideal for those ready to dive in and make a significant contribution.

We are excited to learn more about you! Apply now to join our team and start making a difference with your analytical skills and insights.




About us:




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services.

Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are helping to shape the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management and Data & Analytics.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to build a better future?




About Enfinity Global

Enfinity Global is a purpose-driven company focused on making a positive impact on the planet by helping companies, governments, and individuals transition to a carbon-free and sustainable economy. Our role as a leading IPP is to develop, finance, build, operate, and own renewable energy assets in the long term in Europe, Asia, and the Americas through our offices in the USA, Spain, Italy, UK, Netherlands, India, and Japan.




Our team of over 250 Enfiniters comprises seasoned finance professionals, as well as experienced project developers and operators with extensive industry experience across all stages of the project life cycle. We pride ourselves on being creative and innovative solution providers to our customers and partners.




We’re looking for a Data Scientis to join our Team in Milan.




Main task and duties:




Responsibilities:

· Analyze large datasets from energy production, prices, and consumption to uncover insights and trends

· Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to optimize energy usage and forecasting (e.g., renewable energy production, demand forecasting)

· Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate key findings to top management

· Assist in building and refining energy price models, optimization strategies, and risk assessment tools

· Perform data cleaning, preprocessing, and feature engineering to prepare data for analysis

· Work closely with market intelligence team to provide actionable insights

· Stay current with trends and innovations in data science and energy markets







Qualifications:

· Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field

· Strong understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data modeling techniques

· Proficiency in Python

· Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI

· Familiarity with SQL for data querying and database management

· Knowledge of energy markets, renewable energy, or sustainability is a plus (but not required)

· Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment

· Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights




In Enfinity Global group you will find a very dynamic and multinational environment in one of the most exciting and impactful industries. Here we will foster your professional and personal growth, and you will have the opportunity to actively contribute and make a real impact on climate change.




Let’s build our future together.







Visit www.enfinity.global to discover more about our culture and values.

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Procuras dar um passo na tua carreira nas áreas de IT e Telecomunicações?




Então chegaste ao sítio certo – à Smart! A tecnologia, a transformação e a inovação fazem parte do nosso ADN. Licenciatura em Engenharia Informática ou similar
Experiência profissional como Data Scientist

Valorizamos as nossas pessoas

Lisboa

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are looking for an innovative and passionate Machine Learning Engineer to join our fast-paced, dynamic team. As a key member of our technology division, you will play a vital role in developing, deploying, and optimizing end-to-end machine learning models. This role demands expertise in MLOps (Machine Learning Operations) and the ability to handle the entire machine learning lifecycle—from data ingestion to model deployment and beyond.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Oppizi, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers and product managers, to deliver high-quality ML solutions that directly impact business outcomes. You will also be responsible for ensuring that our models are scalable, efficient, and aligned with the company's goals.

Key Responsibilities:


Model Development and Deployment: Design, implement, and deploy machine learning models that address business needs, ensuring high availability and performance in production environments
MLOps and Automation: Apply MLOps best practices to automate the ML lifecycle, including data ingestion, training, and deployment pipelines. Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines for continuous integration and delivery
Performance Monitoring and Optimization: Monitor deployed models to ensure they meet performance metrics, and continuously improve them for accuracy and scalability
Collaboration and Communication: Work closely with software engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to develop and communicate ML solutions effectively



Requirements

What are you bringing to the team:


Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, or a related field
Experience: Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role
MLOps Expertise: Proven experience with MLOps tools and frameworks (e.g., MLflow, Kubeflow, TensorFlow Extended)
Programming Skills: Strong proficiency in Python and experience with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn
Cloud & Containerization: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, and familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes
Data & API Proficiency: Experience with data manipulation and building APIs using frameworks such as FastAPI, Flask, or Django
Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders


Nice to have:


Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark)
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Knowledge of DevOps practices and tools



Benefits

Competitive salary (open to negotiation) with performance-based bonuses.

Professional growth opportunities in a fast-growing startup.

Flexible working hours and remote work options.
